section.title: Introduction
section.para: Using the Python opcode family, you can interact with a Python3 interpreter embedded in Csound in five ways:

listitem.simpara: Initialize the Python interpreter (the pyinit opcodes),
Invoke a callable and pass arguments (the pycall opcodes),
Evaluate an expression (the pyeval opcodes), or
Change the value of a Python object, possibly creating a new Python object (the pyassign opcodes);

section.para: and you can do any of these things:

listitem.simpara: In the global Python namespace, or in a namespace specific to an individual instance of a Csound instrument (local or "l" context),
